appearances.title: The Evening Edit : FBC : January 12, 2026 5:00pm-6:00pm EST
appearances.snippet: montana senator tim sheehy, meanwhile, accused democrats of a deafening silence so far on the issue. >> you'll have wall the wall coverage of a handful of old, gray-haired liberals protesting with signs on any street corner in america. yet now we have millions of youth in iran. finally what appears to be destabilizing a 46-year regime of terror, murder and one of the middle east's most impactful nations, ask it's getting little to no coverage. >> reporter: protesters with competing causes also clashed in washington state sunday, groups protesting unrest in iran there converged with one another. anti-i.c.e. agitators as well as activists who were chanting free palestine, this leading to tense scenes there as the crowds treed to shout over -- tried to shout over one another to. the state department has said that the administration's priority is on allowing diplomacy to be conducted between the washington and tehran, to allow these protests to play out. but at the same time, liz, the president and secretary of state have said they have multiple options to respond to these protests. read

appearances.title: Inside Politics With Dana Bash : CNNW : January 9, 2026 9:00am-10:00am PST
appearances.snippet: tim sheehy, the senator, republican senator from montana, was here a couple of days ago, and i asked him about it, and he said, you know, everybody is taking the president as before. you're out of context. and he says he's running. it doesn't mean forever. and then he comes out and says to you for a very long time, i feel like based on my own morality is going to be one of those quotes that will be very high in the history books written of donald trump's second term. >> it's the fascinating thing about trump. he just says it right. like he just he just puts it out there. and to me, this has been the consistent through line of this second term. whether we talk about stephen miller's obsession with plenary power, whether we talk about the way they've used executive authority from things from doj, domestic policy, international policy, their through line has been donald trump's kind of overarching view that he is unchecked and that congress has basically. and, you know, i was on the hill yesterday there talking about their kind of abdication of power to kind of fuel trump's kind of all
